newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street seen higher at open, cheers Fed.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street seen higher at open, cheers Fed.

text.p: Wall Street is seen opening higher on Wednesday, extending a rally started after the Federal Reserve decided to leave short term rates unchanged.
The Dow Jones industrial average surged higher following the news on Tuesday, closing up 74.58 points at 7,303.46 after spending most of the day on negative ground. Bonds also rose.

It roared up on a wave of relief when the Federal Open Market Committee, a Fed policy arm which guides rates, said it would let the key federal funds rate stand at 5.5 percent. Analysts had been split over whether rates would rise.
